job.title: Design Lead
job.description:
Rightpoint, a Genpact company (NYSE: G) is a global experience leader. Over 700 employees across 12 offices work with clients end-to-end, from defining and enabling vision, to ensuring ongoing market relevance. Our diverse teams lead with empathy, data, and creativity—always in service of the experience. From whiteboard to roll-out, we help our clients embed experience across their operations from front to back office to accelerate digital transformation through a human-centric lens.

Are you someone who wants to inspire change in the way business is done? Do you want to work with encouraged and like-minded intrapreneurs? Us too! We take our work very seriously, but we have fun doing it. And we’re searching for passionate, talented people to join the Rightpoint team.

Our Commitment to You

No matter who you are, where you come from, who you love, what you believe, or what you get excited about, we bring people together to make phenomenal work. That's what makes us Rightpoint!

 

You will be engaged with one of Rightpoint's clients and work on some very dynamic and innovative projects. The client is one of the leaders in the Financial Services Industry. Currently, this role is fully remote; however, that may change and require being in the Toronto, Canada office in a hybrid capacity.

At this time, we are only considering candidates that are currently living in the Greater Toronto area.

 

As a Design Lead at Rightpoint you are responsible for translating ideas and concepts into useful and engaging solutions—user interfaces. You’ll be working with other visual designers, user experience designers and strategists. We are looking for people who are passionate about design and eager to collaborate with other individuals to solve problems.   

 

What You’ll Be Doing and The Impact You’ll Make:

If you believe that design is at the heart of the best digital experiences and that there is no better way to bring stories to life, we want to talk with you. This is an opportunity to work on high profile work defining the future of digital experiences from automotive to apps to websites. If you would like to surround yourself with people that share the same passion for design and exploration, please see how you align with the needs listed below.
 

What We’d Love to See:

  • A degree in design or a design-related discipline (industrial design, user-centered design, visual design, design strategy, design management, human factors, psychology, human-computer interaction, etc.)
  • 7-10 years of design experience with at least 3 years of leading a design team
  • 3+ years mobile design or responsive design experience
  • Expert understanding of user-centered design methods and principles
  • Highly proficient in UX related software packages (Figma, Axure, Adobe Creative Suite)
  • Solid understanding of all creative disciplines (experience strategy, visual design, copywriting, design research, interaction design)
  • Conceptual ideation and visualization skills
  • UX Research background; conducting user tests and analysis of research findings.
  • Strong user interface design
  • Comfortable leveraging and expanding upon existing design systems
  • A tireless desire to learn driven by curiosity
  • A burning passion for art and science

What You’ll be doing

  • Leading a creative team from Concept to Implementation
  • Articulating design approaches and rationales to colleagues and stakeholders
  • Adapting processes to meet project needs,
  • Focusing on product and service design

 

 

EEO Statement

Rightpoint, a Genpact Company, is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, age, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, military/veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, physical or mental disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. We are committed to creating a dynamic work environment that values diversity and inclusion, respect and integrity, customer focus, and innovation.

job.title: Interaction Design Lead
job.description:
Rightpoint, a Genpact company, is the digital consultancy with technology at its core. We design and engineer end-to-end experiences that help our clients succeed at the speed of innovation. Rightpoint serves more than 250 Fortune 1000 companies. 

Are you someone who wants to create change in the way business is done? Do you want to work with inspired and like-minded intrapreneurs? Us too! We take our work very seriously, but we have fun doing it. And we’re searching for passionate, talented people to join the Rightpoint team.

 

Our Commitment to You

No matter who you are, where you come from, who you love, what you believe, or what you get excited about, we bring people together to make phenomenal work. That's what makes us Rightpoint!

 

Intro

We are looking for a talented Senior Interaction Designer (UX/UI) to join our team and help us create the future of design and interaction for some of the world’s largest brands.

 

You will be engaged with one of Rightpoints clients and work on some very dynamic and innovative projects. The client is one of the leaders in the Financial Services Industry. Currently, this role is fully remote; however, that may change and require being in the Toronto, Canada office in a hybrid capacity.

At this time we are only considering candidates that are currently living in the Greater Toronto area.


What You’ll Be Doing and The Impact You’ll Make:


If you believe that design is at the heart of the best digital experiences and that there is no better way to bring stories to life, we want to talk with you. If you would like to surround yourself with people that share the same passion for design and exploration, please see how you align with the needs listed below.
 

The senior interaction designer's primary role includes ensuring that products are intuitive and accessible for users. They look to develop and implement innovative experiences that are tailored to each segment of the organization's customer base. Working with the product development team, they compare and contrast the proposed approaches and designs from the lens of the product's usability and layout. Always conscious of enhancing the customer's experience, senior interaction designers ensure that even small changes or alterations made to the product do not negatively impact the customer's experience with the product. Identify key user cases and user flows for proposed features. Design wireframes and/or visual screens that align to business requirements. Works closely with UX Researchers and conducts usability testing, contributes to usability hypotheses, and participates in the user experience analysis. Collaborate and provide support to development teams through the development cycle up to the launch. Conduct design QA against QA site via production staging link.



What We’d Love to See:

  • A great online portfolio that showcases multiple types of projects and solutions that you have had direct work within and can explicitly demonstrate your contributions
  • Mid-Senior level professional experience in the User Experience field
  • Ability to think conceptually and create and/or take direction and bring it to life
  • Ability to use data and research to inform design decisions
  • Tireless desire to learn driven by curiosity and a great collaborative attitude
  • Ability to simplify complex requirements
  • Robust documentation practices
  • A full understanding of foundational design best practices
  • Mastery in experience design tools such as Figma, Sketch, and Axure
  • UX Research background; conducting user tests, analysis of research findings, and recommendations that have impactful outcomes
  • Ability to prototype and clearly articulate design ideas
  • Agency experience or similar
  • Proficiency in visual and UI design

 

EEO Statement

Rightpoint, a Genpact Company, is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, age, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, military/veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, physical or mental disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. We are committed to creating a dynamic work environment that values diversity and inclusion, respect and integrity, customer focus, and innovation.

job.title: Data Engineer
job.description:
Rightpoint, a Genpact company (NYSE: G) is a global experience leader. Over 12 offices work with clients end-to-end, from defining and enabling vision, to ensuring ongoing market relevance. Our diverse teams lead with empathy, data and creativity—always in service of the experience. From whiteboard to roll-out, we help our clients embed experience across their operations from front to back office to accelerate digital transformation through a human-centric lens. Rightpoint has been recognized among the top customer experience consultancies in The Forrester Wave™: Customer Experience Strategy Consulting Practices, Q4 2020. 

Are you someone who wants to inspire change in the way business is done? Do you want to work with encouraged and like-minded intrapreneurs? Us too! We take our work very seriously, but we have fun doing it. And we’re searching for passionate, talented people to join the Rightpoint team. 

Our Commitment to You 

No matter who you are, where you come from, who you love, what you believe, or what you geek out about, we bring people together to make great work. That's what makes us Rightpoint!! 

 

Brief About Role 

The Senior Data Engineer, Analytics role falls into the Data Engineering practice within the Systems and IT department. The Senior Data Engineer focuses on building cutting edge, strategic data and analytics solutions leveraging BI solutions. You will use your experience in data engineering and data visualization to work with RP business units including Finance, IT, Operations, People Potential (HR), Sales, Marketing, and Delivery practices to help them become more data driven by providing timely, trustworthy data and insights.  

What you'll do: 

  • Responsible for building and creating data visualization, business intelligence reports and dashboards. 
  • Work with business leadership to define business intelligence requirements, Key performance indicators (KPI), priorities and data solutions. 
  • Contribute as part of the Systems and IT Data Engineering team to the enterprise data analytics and reports. 
  • Accountable for facilitating data gathering, requirement analysis, data analysis and building reports. 
  • Hands-on development of Power BI dashboards 
  • Ensure proper standards, policies and procedures are followed. 
  • Leverage data to provide meaningful insights to business leaders and use BI tools to support operational processes by delivering data visualization reports and dashboards. 
  • Utilizes an advanced understanding of multiple data structures and sources to lead the design, development and implementation of decision support solutions, which may include data visualization, business intelligence, or data collection. 

What We’d Like to See: 

  • 5+ years demonstrated advanced proficiency in data, analytics, and BI development. 
  • 5+ years demonstrated understanding of database technology, SQL, and data warehousing design patterns 
  • Track record of creating effective reports and dashboards in Power BI 
  • Interest in thinking broader than data visualization, curiosity to expand skills to other forms of analytics and data applications. 
  • At least 4-year hands-on work experience with Microsoft Power BI, experience of working in AAS environment will be Plus. 
  • Experience in optimizing Microsoft Power BI dashboards with a focus on usability, performance, flexibility, testability, and standardization. 
  • Solid understanding of the following concepts 
  • Data visualization 
  • Data modeling 
  • Data warehousing 
  • ETL Design and Development 
  • Data lineage, integrity, and validation  
  • Data quality / clean up  

 

  • Relevant hands-on development experience in the following:  
  • Design and develop reports and dashboards using PowerBI, Tableau, Qlik, amongst others. 
  • Design and develop database stored procedures, functions, views and queries using various SQL standards (e.g. T-SQL, PL/SQL, etc.)  
  • Design, develop, tune and maintain ETL packages using ETL tools such as SSIS and Azure Data Factory  
  • Hands on experiences with Azure tools or their analogues AWS / Google cloud tools (this is not an exhaustive list)  
  • Information Management: Data Factory, Data Catalog, Event Hubs  
  • Data Storage: Azure Blob Storage, Azure Database, Azure Data Lake Storage  
  • Big Data Solution: Azure Data Lake Storage / Analytics, HD Insight, Azure Data Warehouse  
  • Azure Analysis Services 

Benefits and Perks at Rightpoint 

  • 30 Paid leaves 
  • Public Holidays 
  • Casual and open office environment 
  • Flexible Work Schedule 
  • Family medical insurance 
  • Regular Cultural & Social Events including Diwali Party, Team Parties, Team outings, etc. 
  • Continuous Training, Certifications, and Learning Opportunities  

 EEO Statement 

Rightpoint, a Genpact Company, is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, age, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, military/veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, physical or mental disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. We are committed to creating a dynamic work environment that values diversity and inclusion, respect and integrity, customer focus, and innovation.

The Senior Data Engineer focuses on building cutting edge, strategic data and analytics solutions leveraging BI solutions. You will use your experience in data engineering and data visualization to work with RP business units including Finance, IT, Operations, People Potential (HR), Sales, Marketing, and Delivery practices to help them become more data driven by providing timely, trustworthy data and insights.

job.title: Senior Site Reliability Engineer
job.description:
Company Overview

Rightpoint is an award-winning digital agency and technology consulting firm. The company brings industry-focused business strategy and technology expertise together with user experience design and creative services to help organizations transform the way they do business.

Rightpoint's digital marketing solutions create brand advocacy and enhance the customer experience through digital channels to accelerate business growth. Rightpoint's enterprise solutions improve operational performance and increase employee productivity within an organization to drive increased profitability. Rightpoint delivers world-class business solutions in areas such as collaboration, social business, CRM, web, digital strategy, mobile, business intelligence, and cloud. The company is deeply rooted in a collaborative, “intrapreneurial” culture with a passion to “WOW” clients.

Based in Chicago, we attract highly qualified professionals with the right combination of business, strategy, creative, and technical skills. Our consultants participate in the growth of an energetic, team-oriented, and entrepreneurial-minded firm with challenging consulting engagements. We are passionately driven to make a personal impact on both the growth and success of the company and our clients. Recent accolades include being named one of the Top 20 Best Places to Work in Chicago in 2013 by Crain's Chicago Business, one of the Seven Small Jewels in 2013 by Consulting Magazine, and among Chicago’s Top 101 Best and Brightest Companies to Work For in 2012 & 2013.

The  Senior Site Reliability Engineer will serve as a technical SME for IT Ops and DevOps.   As the Senior Developer, he/she will be responsible for leading the administration and support of enterprise applications within Microsoft Azure, O365, Amazon Web Services, and Rackspace.  The architect needs to have the aptitude to lead the requirements gathering, analysis, design, and implementation of solutions in public Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) and Platform as a Service (PaaS).  As the technical lead for the IT Ops and DevOps Practice the solution arch will oversee the technical delivery of IT Ops and DevOps. 

The team lead will have organizational and delivery responsibility. He / She will have management and leadership responsibilities for the Rightpoint IT Ops and DevOps team in Jaipur India.

Responsibilities

  • Provide technical leadership for Rightpoint IT Ops and DevOps Team
  • Implement, Administer and Support cloud Infrastructure solutions including Virtual Machines, cloud services and virtual network configurations
  • Implement, Administer and Support Highly Available solutions in multiple environments such as Azure Load Balancing services, Active Directory Federation Services and Web Application Proxy configurations
  • Apply security fundamentals and best practices in the design and implementation of solutions
  • Provide technical leadership for the management, operations, and support of cloud solutions post implementation
  • Collaborate with internal Application Development team as well as our clients to implement consistent Development and Production environment leveraging DevOps best practices
  • Provide technical guidance for onboarding new environment into IT Ops and DevOps with an end to end solution focus
  • Act as a technical escalation for troubleshooting complex issues
  • Act as an incident manager

 

Minimum Requirements

  • A minimum of 5 years progressive IT experience is required
  • 5+ years’ experience working with Cloud technologies (Microsoft, AWS, Rackspace) required
  • 5+ years’ experience with Microsoft Azure and O365
  • 5+ years’ experience in consulting or digital agency
  • 2+ years’ experience in leading
  • Hands-on knowledge of the Microsoft Stack of Technologies
  • Hands-on knowledge of network security and compliance is preferred (encryption, security audit)
  • Hands-on knowledge of Networking (VPN, firewalls, switching, load balancers, DNS, CDN)
  • Exceptional documentation skills and attention to detail for documentation (design documentation, processes/procedures, environment diagrams, etc.) 
  • Experience with web delivered technologies (IIS, Sitecore, EpiServer, SharePoint)
  • Experience with management platforms such as SCCM, SCOM, OMS, Application Insights
  • Experience with PowerShell and advanced scripting languages
  • Experience with virtualization solution architecture including Microsoft Hyper-V and VMware is a plus

Recently Crain’s ranked Rightpoint among the “Top 20 Best Places to Work in Chicago.” Why? In large part because Rightpoint walks the talk in term of its culture. On a scale of 1-10, “How likely would you be to refer us to a friend or colleague?” – We strive for an average of 9, and are currently exceeding that goal. We ask the same question of our employees: “On a scale of 1-10, how likely are you to recommend Rightpoint to a friend as a place to work?” And, we’re proud to say that our average score exceeds 9 on that front too.

Why do the best want to work here? The reasons vary but, for many, it’s because they are challenged by their work and because they get to work with some of the most influential companies in Chicago. At Rightpoint’s offices, conference rooms have names like Hickory, Dickory, and Dock and we have a “WOW” Wall where Rightpointers and our clients can recognize accomplishments of colleagues by filling out a “Holy Sheet!”

What are some other things that add to the texture of Rightpoint? We thrive to give back to the community and have a Compassion Crew that organizes regular events.   • Provide technical leadership for the management, operations, and support of cloud solutions post implementation
  • Collaborate with internal Application Development team as well as our clients to implement consistent Development and Production environment leveraging DevOps best practices
  • Provide technical guidance for onboarding new environment into IT Ops and DevOps with an end to end solution focus
  • Act as a technical escalation for troubleshooting complex issues
  • Act as an incident manager

 

Minimum Requirements

  • A minimum of 5 years progressive IT experience is required
  • 5+ years’ experience working with Cloud technologies (Microsoft, AWS, Rackspace) required
  • 5+ years’ experience with Microsoft Azure and O365
  • 5+ years’ experience in consulting or digital agency
  • 2+ years’ experience in leading
  • Hands-on knowledge of the Microsoft Stack of Technologies
  • Hands-on knowledge of network security and compliance is preferred (encryption, security audit)
  • Hands-on knowledge of Networking (VPN, firewalls, switching, load balancers, DNS, CDN)
  • Exceptional documentation skills and attention to detail for documentation (design documentation, processes/procedures, environment diagrams, etc.) 
  • Experience with web delivered technologies (IIS, Sitecore, EpiServer, SharePoint)
  • Experience with management platforms such as SCCM, SCOM, OMS, Application Insights
  • Experience with PowerShell and advanced scripting languages
  • Experience with virtualization solution architecture including Microsoft Hyper-V and VMware is a plus
  • Working knowledge of email technologies (Exchange, mail routing, mail security filtering, etc.)
  • Focus on making yourself and those around you great.
  • Motivation with an emphasis on team performance.
  • Eagerness to learn and work outside your technology comfort zone.
  • Ability to be self-motivated, independent, and detail-oriented.
  • Exhibit exceptional relationship management skills.
  • Demonstrate excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Knowledge of sound business practices and a proven track record of anticipating and exceeding customer expectations.

Required Education

Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, MIS, or related field.

What’s it like to work at Rightpoint?

Recently Crain’s ranked Rightpoint among the “Top 20 Best Places to Work in Chicago.” Why? In large part because Rightpoint walks the talk in term of its culture. Rightpoint has a set of 7 values and uses them as a compass. In addition, Rightpointers have passion for their work. They want to build something and enjoy solving complex problems every day in a collaborative environment. Our founders wanted to foster a culture where team members feel challenged yet love what they are doing so much so that they envision Rightpoint being the last stop in their career.

We hire A-Players because we are working on cutting-edge projects and our clients expect solutions that will WOW them. We help some of Chicago’s top businesses find solutions to their digital needs. After we deliver our solutions, we ask our clients a very basic question. On a scale of 1-10, “How likely would you be to refer us to a friend or colleague?” – We strive for an average of 9, and are currently exceeding that goal. We ask the same question of our employees: “On a scale of 1-10, how likely are you to recommend Rightpoint to a friend as a place to work?” And, we’re proud to say that our average score exceeds 9 on that front too.

Why do the best want to work here? The reasons vary but, for many, it’s because they are challenged by their work and because they get to work with some of the most influential companies in Chicago. The icing on the cake is that they also have a great time doing it! We take our work very seriously but ourselves? Not so much. At Rightpoint’s offices, conference rooms have names like Hickory, Dickory, and Dock and we have a “WOW” Wall where Rightpointers and our clients can recognize accomplishments of colleagues by filling out a “Holy Sheet!”

What are some other things that add to the texture of Rightpoint? We thrive to give back to the community and have a Compassion Crew that organizes regular events. Our Culture Club ensures that our culture is engrained in everything we do and we stay consistent with our values. Oh, and did we mention we have a Keg in our kitchen where we gather around most Fridays for a “Rightpint” Happy Hour? And we cater in lunch every other Friday? Those are just a few examples of what makes Rightpoint a truly great place to work.

Company Overview

Rightpoint is an award-winning digital agency and technology consulting firm. The company brings industry-focused business strategy and technology expertise together with user experience design and creative services to help organizations transform the way they do business.

Rightpoint's digital marketing solutions create brand advocacy and enhance the customer experience through digital channels to accelerate business growth. Rightpoint's enterprise solutions improve operational performance and increase employee productivity within an organization to drive increased profitability. Rightpoint delivers world-class business solutions in areas such as collaboration, social business, CRM, web, digital strategy, mobile, business intelligence, and cloud. The company is deeply rooted in a collaborative, “intrapreneurial” culture with a passion to “WOW” clients.

Based in Chicago, we attract highly qualified professionals with the right combination of business, strategy, creative, and technical skills. Our consultants participate in the growth of an energetic, team-oriented, and entrepreneurial-minded firm with challenging consulting engagements. We are passionately driven to make a personal impact on both the growth and success of the company and our clients. Recent accolades include being named one of the Top 20 Best Places to Work in Chicago in 2013 by Crain's Chicago Business, one of the Seven Small Jewels in 2013 by Consulting Magazine, and among Chicago’s Top 101 Best and Brightest Companies to Work For in 2012 & 2013.

job.title: HR Director
job.description:
Job Summary:

The Director is responsible for developing a global approach to HR Operations in line with RIGHTPOINT’s business needs, culture, and values. The Director will coordinate with the current HR team that will provide HR services in support of business objectives. The Director will also ensure that RIGHTPOINT is aware of and compliant with all local/state/federal laws and policies applicable and relevant to HR practices.

Operations & Compliance

  • Own the design and maintenance of RIGHTPOINT policies in alignment with RIGHTPOINT values, appropriate laws, and regulations
  • Manage the review and approval of any policy exceptions
  • Manage protocols and processes related to investigations (harassment, discrimination, etc.)
  • Understand and interpret all relevant local/ state/ federal regulations, ensuring that HR operations forms, reports, processes, policies, and recordkeeping are compliant
  • Manage RIGHTPOINT operations teams, provide oversight and review of consulting, immigration (work authorization), relocation, and travel services

HR Team Coordination

  • Partner with the HR leadership team to ensure that HR services and support are well-timed, well-packaged, and well-understood
  • Ensure the effective, timely and clear communication of RIGHTPOINT HR business practices
  • Create systems and processes to support the consistent, compliant and comprehensive application of RIGHTPOINT HR business practices

 

Diversity and Inclusion

  • Ensure RIGHTPOINT HR practices reflect a commitment to Diversity and Inclusion, signifying that RIGHTPOINT is welcoming and supportive for staff regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, age, religion, language, abilities/disabilities, socioeconomic status, and geographic region
  • Advice on RIGHTPOINT diversity and inclusion strategy; establish tasks and benchmarks for executives, leaders and internal/external stakeholders that result in a more diverse and inclusive environment;
  • Manage a communication strategy that conveys RIGHTPOINT’ commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
  • Foster an inclusive environment by implementing and supporting diversity initiatives and structures such as employee resource groups, diversity education, and staffing and supplier diversity

 

Qualifications:

  • Minimum of 15 years of progressive experience HR Operations; thorough knowledge and understanding of applicable state laws
  • MBA in Human Resources, Business Administration, Organizational Behavior or related field, Master’s degree preferred
  • HR Certifications will be plus.

Experience and Skills:

  • Experience leading and developing HR professionals
  • Experience in delivering HR services through a business partner model
  • Experience advising both staff and management on Employee Relations issues, including an up to date understanding of employment legislation
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills as well as active listening skills
  • Excellent interpersonal skills, and a vast understanding of human relations; high level of emotional intelligence
  • Ability to assess multi-faceted issues, anticipate potential problems, and apply a high level of skill and judgment around complex and ambiguous issues
  • Ability to influence and partner with different levels of staff to achieve results
  • Ability to introduce continuous process improvements in HR operational areas
  • Ability to be discrete and maintain confidentiality
  • Ability to demonstrate presence and credibility within the organization
  • Ability to support and champion the mission, vision, and values of RIGHTPOINT

 Preferences:

  • Experience in coordinating with the US team.
  • Female candidates will be preferred.

Benefits and Perks at Rightpoint

  • 30 Paid leaves
  • Public Holidays
  • Casual and open office environment
  • Flexible Work Schedule
  • Family medical insurance
  • Regular Cultural & Social Events including Diwali Party, Team Parties, Team outings, etc.
  • Continuous Training, Certifications, and Learning Opportunities 

Our Commitment to You

No matter who you are, where you come from, who you love, what you believe, or what you geek out about, we bring people together to make great work. That's what makes us Rightpoint!!

EEO Statement

Rightpoint, a Genpact Company, is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, age, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, military/veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, physical or mental disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. We are committed to creating a dynamic work environment that values diversity and inclusion, respect and integrity, customer focus, and innovation.

job.title: Technical Support Technician
job.description:
Job Description: The Technical Support Analyst assists employees with a wide array of computing and other technical issues on a day-to-day basis. The ideal candidate needs to have the aptitude to lend technical assistance for 400+ in-person and remote users both quickly and gracefully. The candidate must also be generally excited about all things technology, exhibit outside-the-box thinking and have an approachable attitude and personality.  This is considered a Level II/III position with room for growth to the right candidate.

Technical Support Responsibilities:

· Research and identify solutions to software and hardware issues

· Diagnose and troubleshoot technical issues, including account setup and network configuration

· Ask customers targeted questions to quickly understand the root of the problem

· Track computer system issues through to resolution, within agreed time limits

· Talk clients through a series of actions, either via phone, email or chat, until they’ve solved a technical issue

· Properly escalate unresolved issues to appropriate internal teams

· Provide prompt and accurate feedback to customers

· Refer to internal database or external resources to provide accurate tech solutions

· Ensure all issues are properly logged

· Prioritize and manage several open issues at one time

· Follow up with clients to ensure their IT systems are fully functional after troubleshooting

· Prepare accurate and timely reports

· Document technical knowledge in the form of notes and manuals

· Maintain jovial relationships with clients

· Taking ownership of customer issues reported and seeing problems through to resolution.

· Researching, diagnosing, troubleshooting and identifying solutions to resolve system issues.

· Following standard procedures for proper escalation of unresolved issues to the appropriate internal teams.

· Manage 24/5 Support in rotational Shifts,

Requirements and skills

· Proven work experience as a Technical Support Engineer, Desktop Support Engineer, IT Help Desk Technician or similar role

· Hands-on experience with Windows/Linux/Mac OS environments

· Good understanding of computer systems, mobile devices and other tech products

· Ability to diagnose and troubleshoot basic technical issues

· Familiarity with remote desktop applications and help desk software (eg. Salesforce, Jira)

· Excellent problem-solving and communication skills

· Ability to provide step-by-step technical help, both written and verbal

· Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or relevant curriculum.

· Additional certification in Microsoft, Linux, Cisco or similar technologies is a plus.

· Hands-on experience in Cloud (Azure) and additional certification is a plus.

· Attention to detail and good problem-solving skills.

· Excellent interpersonal skills.

· Good written and verbal communication

Rightpoint, a Genpact company (NYSE: G) is a global experience leader. Over 700 employees across 12 offices work with clients end-to-end, from defining and enabling vision, to ensuring ongoing market relevance. Our diverse teams lead with empathy, data and creativity—always in service of the experience. From whiteboard to roll-out, we help our clients embed experience across their operations from front to back office to accelerate digital transformation through a human-centric lens. Rightpoint, a Genpact company, is the digital consultancy with technology at its core. We design and engineer end-to-end experiences that help our clients succeed at the speed of innovation. Rightpoint serves more than 250 Fortune 1000 companies.

Are you someone who wants to inspire change in the way business is done? Do you want to work with encouraged and like-minded intrapreneurs? Us too! We take our work very seriously, but we have fun doing it. And we’re searching for passionate, talented people to join the Rightpoint team.

Our Commitment to You
No matter who you are, where you come from, who you love, what you believe, or what you geek out about, we bring people together to make great work. That's what makes us Rightpoint!!

What You’ll Do and the Impact You’ll Make:

  • Collaborate with a global cross-functional team in building customer-centric software products
  • Analyze existing software implementations to identify areas of improvement and provide deadline estimates for implementing new features
  • Develop software applications using technologies that include and not limited to core Java (11+ ), Kafka or messaging system, Web Frameworks like Struts / Spring, relational (Oracle) and non-relational databases (SQL, MongoDB, Hadoop, etc), with RESTful microservice architecture
  • Implement security and data protection features
  • Update and maintain documentation for team processes, best practices, and software runbooks
  • Collaborating with git in a multi-developer team
  • Appreciation for clean and well documented code
  • Contribution to database design and management, including being up on the latest practices and associated versions
  • Establish trusted partnerships with peers, product heads, and executive level stakeholders

What We’d Love to See: 

Mandatory Skills:

  • 3-5 years of relevant professional experience using core Java as a programming language

    • REST Microservice developer

      - Java/Spring

      - Hazelcast for caching layer

      - MongoDB for most of the persistence

      - RDBMS for some of the persistence (but less frequent)

      - Microservices Architecture does interservice communication using a proprietary messaging service 

      - Some Python exists in their stack, so Python is a plus

    • Strong communication skills and work ethics.
    • Passionate about professional software development.

      Additional skills - Preferred to be (Not Mandatory)

      • This is a hands-on developer positions within a small elite development team that moves very fast.
      • Among all technical skills, core java knowledge and experience as well as OO design skills is preference #1; JEE including JDBC, Spring, JPA/Hibernate #2; Microservices architecture and Kubernetes experience 
      • Knowledge and experience with messaging (RabbitMQ/Kafka), Redis, websocket is a big plus

  • 30 Paid leaves
  • Public Holidays
  • Casual and open office environment
  • Flexible Work Schedule
  • Family medical insurance
  • Accidental Insurance
  • Life Insurance
  • Regular Cultural & Social Events including Diwali Party, Team Parties, Team outings, etc.

job.title: Developer 2 Frontend (Angular)-HTD
job.description:
What You’ll Do and the Impact You’ll Make:

  • Candidate must have strong knowledge and experience with Angular Framework. (Angular 8.0 Above Version)
  • Cooperating with the back-end developer in the process of building the RESTful API
  • Working with User Experience team members and .NET Developers through the stages of design, development, QA, launch, and maintenance
  • Communicating with external web services
  • Writing tested, idiomatic, and documented JavaScript, HTML and CSS(SASS/LESS)
  • Ensuring high performance on mobile and desktop, application with cross-browser compatible
  • Working with Project Managers, providing a list of branding objectives and estimating work/hour estimates for these objectives
  • Must have knowledge of any UI frameworks (Bootstrap, foundation, skeleton
  • Helping solve branding issues in the integration of HTML and CSS into packaged products or SAAS solutions
  • Ensuring that the integrity of designs, branding elements, and user experience standards are maintained throughout development
  • Producing working prototypes that explore new approaches to UI design and WOW customers

 

What We’d Love to See: 

  • 3 year experience with HTML, CSS, jQuery, and JavaScript required. 
  • Experience in, React JS, VUE JS, Node JS a plus
  • SEO Experience a plus
  • Exposure to Web Content Management and Collaboration solutions such as Sitecore/EpiServer/SharePoint a plus!
  • A passion for detail, finding that perfect solution and understanding of how the problem was solved

Some Cool Extra’s:

  • Adding examples of your work to your resume and/or application. 
  • Demonstrate prior consulting experience.
  • Exposure to project management experiences is a plus.
  • Familiarity working within a .NET environment.

Benefits and Perks at Rightpoint

  • 30 Paid leaves
  • Public Holidays
  • Casual and open office environment
  • Flexible Work Schedule
  • Family medical insurance
  • Employee Life Insurance
  • Employee Accidental Insurance

job.title: Senior Developer- Java (MS) / L04
job.description:
What You’ll Do and the Impact You’ll Make:

  • Collaborate with a global cross-functional team in building customer-centric software products
  • Analyze existing software implementations to identify areas of improvement and provide deadline estimates for implementing new features
  • Develop software applications using technologies that include and not limited to core Java (11+ ), Kafka or messaging system, Web Frameworks like Struts / Spring, relational (Oracle) and non-relational databases (SQL, MongoDB, Hadoop, etc), with RESTful microservice architecture
  • Implement security and data protection features
  • Update and maintain documentation for team processes, best practices, and software runbooks
  • Collaborating with git in a multi-developer team
  • Appreciation for clean and well documented code
  • Contribution to database design and management, including being up on the latest practices and associated versions
  • Establish trusted partnerships with peers, product heads, and executive level stakeholders

 

What We’d Love to See: 

Mandatory Skills:

  • 4+ years of relevant professional experience using core Java as a programming language

    • REST Microservice developer

      - Java/Spring

      - Hazelcast for caching layer

      - MongoDB for most of the persistence

      - RDBMS for some of the persistence (but less frequent)

      - Microservices Architecture does interservice communication using a proprietary messaging service 

      - Some Python exists in their stack, so Python is a plus

    • Strong communication skills and work ethics.
    • Passionate about professional software development.

      Additional skills - Preferred to be (Not Mandatory)

      • This is a hands-on developer positions within a small elite development team that moves very fast.
      • Among all technical skills, core java knowledge and experience as well as OO design skills is preference #1; JEE including JDBC, Spring, JPA/Hibernate #2; Microservices architecture and Kubernetes experience 
      • Knowledge and experience with messaging (RabbitMQ/Kafka), Redis, websocket is a big plus

Benefits and Perks at Rightpoint

  • 30 Paid leaves
  • Public Holidays
  • Casual and open office environment
  • Flexible Work Schedule
  • Family medical insurance
  • Regular Cultural & Social Events including Diwali Party, Team Parties, Team outings, etc.
  • Continuous Training, Certifications, and Learning Opportunities 

 EEO Statement

Rightpoint, a Genpact Company, is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, age, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, military/veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, physical or mental disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. We are committed to creating a dynamic work environment that values diversity and inclusion, respect and integrity, customer focus, and innovation

job.title: Sr. Frontend Developer (Angular)-L05
job.description:
What You’ll Do and the Impact You’ll Make:

  • Candidate must have strong knowledge and experience with Angular Framework. (Angular 8.0 Above Version)
  • Cooperating with the back-end developer in the process of building the RESTful API
  • Working with User Experience team members and .NET Developers through the stages of design, development, QA, launch, and maintenance
  • Communicating with external web services
  • Writing tested, idiomatic, and documented JavaScript, HTML and CSS(SASS/LESS)
  • Ensuring high performance on mobile and desktop, application with cross-browser compatible
  • Working with Project Managers, providing a list of branding objectives and estimating work/hour estimates for these objectives
  • Must have knowledge of any UI frameworks (Bootstrap, foundation, skeleton
  • Helping solve branding issues in the integration of HTML and CSS into packaged products or SAAS solutions
  • Ensuring that the integrity of designs, branding elements, and user experience standards are maintained throughout development
  • Producing working prototypes that explore new approaches to UI design and WOW customers

 

What We’d Love to See: 

  • 4+ year experience with HTML, CSS, jQuery, and JavaScript required. 
  • Experience in, React JS, VUE JS, Node JS a plus
  • SEO Experience a plus
  • Exposure to Web Content Management and Collaboration solutions such as Sitecore/EpiServer/SharePoint a plus!
  • A passion for detail, finding that perfect solution and understanding of how the problem was solved

Some Cool Extra’s:

  • Adding examples of your work to your resume and/or application. 
  • Demonstrate prior consulting experience.
  • Exposure to project management experiences is a plus.
  • Familiarity working within a .NET environment.

job.description:
Rightpoint, a Genpact company (NYSE: G) is a global experience leader. Over 1000 employees across 12 offices work with clients end-to-end, from defining and enabling vision, to ensuring ongoing market relevance. Our diverse teams lead with empathy, data and creativity—always in service of the experience. From whiteboard to roll-out, we help our clients embed experience across their operations from front to back office to accelerate digital transformation through a human-centric lens. Are you someone who wants to inspire change in the way business is done? Do you want to work with encouraged and like-minded intrapreneurs? Us too! We take our work very seriously, but we have fun doing it. And we’re searching for passionate, talented people to join the Rightpoint team.

Our Commitment to You

No matter who you are, where you come from, who you love, what you believe, or what you get excited about, we bring people together to make phenomenal work. That's what makes us Rightpoint!

Check out our Sizzle Reel showcasing some of our latest work here. For more information, visit rightpoint.com and connect with us on LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook and Instagram.

 

Are you someone who wants to create change in the way business is done? Do you want to work with inspired and like-minded intrapreneurs? Us too! We take our work very seriously, but we have fun doing it. And we’re searching for passionate, talented people to join the Rightpoint team.

 

What You’ll Do

If you don't see a role that is a fit, but are interested in joining our talent pipeline, apply here! 

Who We Are

Intrapreneurship is defined as creating from within, starting something from nothing. And it is at the heart of the people at Rightpoint. We are a values-led organization driven by innovation, rooted in technology and relentlessly curious. We’re a start-up at heart and we’re able to move quickly to build unique, innovative customer experiences that evolve the way our clients do business. 

Why Rightpoint?

  • Flexible PTO – If you need a day off or an extended vacation, take the time!
  • Hybrid work environment: Casual and open office or Remote…You choose!
  • Great insurance coverage (Multiple Options) and flexible spending accounts
  • 401K with Company Matching
  • Regular Cultural & Social Events including: Community Volunteer Opportunities, Happy Hours, Team Outings, Intramural Sports, and more
  • Monthly WFH/cell phone stipend
  • Continuous Training, Certifications, and Learning Opportunities
  • Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion: We care about making Rightpoint a more diverse, equitable, and inclusive organization to bring about meaningful and measurable changes to representation, team member experience, and client engagement. Here's how:
    • Employee Resource Groups (ERG): Our ERGs are created and run by team members who share a common community, identity, or allyship. Right now, our ERGs include Parents, Pride, POC, and Womxn. These groups play a vital role in contributing to Rightpoint’s inclusive environment where all are valued and empowered to succeed.
    • Partnerships: Out-in-Tech, POINT Foundation, WomenHack, Girls Inc., and more!
    • Mentorship Program

 

EEO Statement

job.title: 3D and Motion Designer - Contractor
job.description:
Rightpoint, a Genpact company (NYSE: G) is a global experience leader. Over 700 employees across 12 offices work with clients end-to-end, from defining and enabling vision, to ensuring ongoing market relevance. Our diverse teams lead with empathy, data and creativity—always in service of the experience. From whiteboard to roll-out, we help our clients embed experience across their operations from front to back office to accelerate digital transformation through a human-centric lens. Rightpoint has been recognized among the top customer experience consultancies in The Forrester Wave™: Customer Experience Strategy Consulting Practices, Q4 2020.

Are you someone who wants to create change in the way business is done? Do you want to work with inspired and like-minded intrapreneurs? Us too! We take our work very seriously, but we have fun doing it. And we’re searching for passionate, talented people to join the Rightpoint team.

Our Commitment to You

We are led by our deep belief that every company is an experience company today or will need to reinvent themselves to become one. At Rightpoint, we design experiences, processes, cultures, content, and technologies for companies to transform who they are, how they act, and how they show up in the world. A values-led intrapreneurial organization, we’re grounded in innovation, focused on transformation and relentlessly curious.

No matter who you are, where you come from, whom you love, what you believe, or what you geek out about, we bring people together to do great work. That's what makes us Rightpoint!

About The Role

***Please note, this is a contract role, scheduled from February to June 2023***

We are looking for a talented Motion Designer to join our team and help us create the future of design and interaction for some of the world’s largest brands.

What You’ll Do and the Impact You’ll Make:

If you believe that motion is at the heart of the best digital experiences and that there is no better way to bring stories to life, we want to talk with you! This is an opportunity to work on high profile work defining the future of digital experiences from automotive to apps to websites.

If you would like to surround yourself with people that share the same passion for design and exploration, please see how you align with the needs listed below.

What We’d Love to See:

  • A great online portfolio that showcases multiple types of projects and solutions that you have had direct work within and can explicitly demonstrate your contributions.
  • 1-3 years of professional experience in the motion design field -Ability to think conceptually and create and/or take direction and bring it to life.
  • Tireless desire to learn driven by curiosity and a great collaborative attitude
  • Pixel-perfect design sensibility and a full understanding of typography.
  • A full understanding of foundational design best practices
  • Mastery in the Adobe After Effects.
  • Proficiency in Photoshop, Illustrator, Sketch and Invision.
  • Ability to prototype and clearly articulate design ideas.
  • Agency experience or similar
  • 3D modeling is a plus
  • Automotive experience beneficial but not mandatory
  • Proficiency in visual and experience design

 

 

EEO Statement

Rightpoint, a Genpact Company, is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, age, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, military/veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, physical or mental disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. We are committed to creating a dynamic work environment that values diversity and inclusion, respect and integrity, customer focus, and innovation.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

What you’ll be doing and the Impact You’ll Make:

  • As an Analytics and Insights Group Director, you will play an instrumental role in growing our team and defining and reimagining how and where to grow our capabilities within the analytics space.
  • A Group Director partners closely with integrated functions including design, strategy, research, and technology to embed the use of data and insights within the design and implementation of our work.
  • You will play a vital role in helping build and educate internal and client teams on the evolution of experience data and analytics, and how we can help.
  • You will lead client engagements that create integrated approaches for data and analytics workstreams
  • Ultimately, you will support the strategy to move analytics and insights deeper into the everyday working of our teams and delivery, which is essential for our overall growth strategy in customer and employee experiences.

 

What we’d love to see:

  • 15 years experience with 5+ years proven experience leading a data and analytics organization (10-20+ team members) including experience in managing people managers.
  • Understands not only how to scope and deliver against project plans within analytics and insights work, but the operational impact a practice has for broader organizational goals and is able to communicate business implications and investment requirements to senior leadership.
  • A future-thinking, growth-minded individual who can distill complexity to think beyond what is being delivered today to set progressive strategic direction to continue to evolve and integrate the use of data and analytics within the work today.
  • Promote the practice by being a teacher to the broader organization and partner with cross-functional leaders to ensure scalability of the work to Rightpoint's growth strategy.
  • Use your entrepreneurial spirit, thriving in ambiguity and are okay when plans shift and change due to ever evolving business needs.
  • Can influence senior leadership and cross-functional practice leadership and "bring them along" within the work we do.
  • Excellence in leading client and internal relationships alike with the interpersonal skills to manage and mentor people at varying seniority.
  • Strong knowledge of defining and executing work within experience data and analytics: strategy, tools, data sources / structures, and analytics methodologies
  • Expertise in understanding and shaping challenging business questions, client requirements, and building relationships through impeccable project delivery
  • Understanding of first-party customer data and digital analytics platforms, including subsequent data tagging structures within tools such as Google Analytics 4 and Adobe Analytics
  • Experience in statistical methods and analysis such as regression, clustering, and time series analysis
  • Ability to lead projects and teams, while at the same time being excited to also roll up your sleeves and get your hands dirty in the work (we are a very hands-on company at all levels).
  • The energy and passion to evangelize our service internally and externally through sales enablement, team education, and internal marketing

 

Why Rightpoint?

  • Flexible PTO – If you need a day off or an extended vacation, take the time!
  • Hybrid work environment: Casual and open office or Remote…You choose!
  • Great insurance coverage (Multiple Options) and flexible spending accounts
  • 401K with Company Matching
  • Regular Cultural & Social Events including: Community Volunteer Opportunities, Happy Hours, Team Outings, Intramural Sports, and more
  • Monthly WFH/cell phone stipend
  • Continuous Training, Certifications, and Learning Opportunities
  • Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion: We care about making Rightpoint a more diverse, equitable, and inclusive organization to bring about meaningful and measurable changes to representation, team member experience, and client engagement. Here's how:
    • Employee Resource Groups (ERG): Our ERGs are created and run by team members who share a common community, identity, or allyship. Right now, our ERGs include Parents, Pride, POC, and Womxn. These groups play a vital role in contributing to Rightpoint’s inclusive environment where all are valued and empowered to succeed.
    • Partnerships: Out-in-Tech, POINT Foundation, WomenHack, Girls Inc., and more!
    • Mentorship Program

 

The approximate annual base compensation range for the Group Analytics Director is $120,000 to $180,100. The actual offer, reflecting the total compensation package plus benefits, will be determined by several factors which include but are not limited to the applicant’s experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities; geographic location; and internal equity. 

 

EEO Statement

We are committed to creating a dynamic work environment that values diversity and inclusion, respect and integrity, customer focus, and innovation.

  • Ultimately, you will support the strategy to move analytics and insights deeper into the everyday working of our teams and delivery, which is essential for our overall growth strategy in customer and employee experiences.

 

What we’d love to see:

  • 15 years experience with 5+ years proven experience leading a data and analytics organization (10-20+ team members) including experience in managing people managers.
  • Understands not only how to scope and deliver against project plans within analytics and insights work, but the operational impact a practice has for broader organizational goals and is able to communicate business implications and investment requirements to senior leadership.
  • A future-thinking, growth-minded individual who can distill complexity to think beyond what is being delivered today to set progressive strategic direction to continue to evolve and integrate the use of data and analytics within the work today.
  • Promote the practice by being a teacher to the broader organization and partner with cross-functional leaders to ensure scalability of the work to Rightpoint's growth strategy.
  • Use your entrepreneurial spirit, thriving in ambiguity and are okay when plans shift and change due to ever evolving business needs.
  • Can influence senior leadership and cross-functional practice leadership and "bring them along" within the work we do.
  • Excellence in leading client and internal relationships alike with the interpersonal skills to manage and mentor people at varying seniority.
  • Strong knowledge of defining and executing work within experience data and analytics: strategy, tools, data sources / structures, and analytics methodologies
  • Expertise in understanding and shaping challenging business questions, client requirements, and building relationships through impeccable project delivery
  • Understanding of first-party customer data and digital analytics platforms, including subsequent data tagging structures within tools such as Google Analytics 4 and Adobe Analytics
  • Experience in statistical methods and analysis such as regression, clustering, and time series analysis
  • Ability to lead projects and teams, while at the same time being excited to also roll up your sleeves and get your hands dirty in the work (we are a very hands-on company at all levels).
  • The energy and passion to evangelize our service internally and externally through sales enablement, team education, and internal marketing

 

Why Rightpoint?

  • Flexible PTO – If you need a day off or an extended vacation, take the time!
  • Hybrid work environment: Casual and open office or Remote…You choose!
  • Great insurance coverage (Multiple Options) and flexible spending accounts
  • 401K with Company Matching
  • Regular Cultural & Social Events including: Community Volunteer Opportunities, Happy Hours, Team Outings, Intramural Sports, and more
  • Monthly WFH/cell phone stipend
  • Continuous Training, Certifications, and Learning Opportunities
  • Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion: We care about making Rightpoint a more diverse, equitable, and inclusive organization to bring about meaningful and measurable changes to representation, team member experience, and client engagement. Here's how:
    • Employee Resource Groups (ERG): Our ERGs are created and run by team members who share a common community, identity, or allyship. Right now, our ERGs include Parents, Pride, POC, and Womxn. These groups play a vital role in contributing to Rightpoint’s inclusive environment where all are valued and empowered to succeed.
    • Partnerships: Out-in-Tech, POINT Foundation, WomenHack, Girls Inc., and more!
    • Mentorship Program

 

The approximate annual base compensation range for the Group Analytics Director is $120,000 to $180,100. The actual offer, reflecting the total compensation package plus benefits, will be determined by several factors which include but are not limited to the applicant’s experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities; geographic location; and internal equity.

job.title: Interaction Design Lead - Contractor
job.description:
Rightpoint, a Genpact company, is the digital consultancy with technology at its core. We design and engineer end-to-end experiences that help our clients succeed at the speed of innovation. Rightpoint serves more than 250 Fortune 1000 companies. 

Are you someone who wants to create change in the way business is done? Do you want to work with inspired and like-minded intrapreneurs? Us too! We take our work very seriously, but we have fun doing it. And we’re searching for passionate, talented people to join the Rightpoint team.

 

Our Commitment to You

No matter who you are, where you come from, who you love, what you believe, or what you get excited about, we bring people together to make phenomenal work. That's what makes us Rightpoint!


Introduction:
We are looking for a talented Senior/Lead Interaction Designer (UX/UI) to join our team and help us create the future of design and interaction for some of the world’s largest brands.


What You’ll Be Do And The Impact You’ll Make:
If you believe that design is at the heart of the best digital experiences and that there is no better way to bring stories to life, we want to talk with you. This is an opportunity to work on high profile work defining the future of digital experiences from automotive to apps to websites. If you would like to surround yourself with people that share the same passion for design and exploration, please see how you align with the needs listed below.
 

What We’d Love To See:

  • A great online portfolio that showcases multiple types of projects and solutions that you have had direct work within and can explicitly demonstrate your contributions
  • Mid-Senior level professional experience in the visual design field
  • Ability to think conceptually and create and/or take direction and bring it to life.
  • Ability to use data and research to inform design decisions
  • Tireless desire to learn driven by curiosity and a great collaborative attitude
  • Ability to simplify complex requirements
  • Robust documentation practices
  • A full understanding of foundational design best practices
  • Mastery in experience design tools such as Figma, Sketch and Invision.
  • Ability to prototype and clearly articulate design ideas
  • Agency experience or similar
  • Proficiency in visual and UI design

job.title: Analytics and Insights - Lead Analyst (Contract)
job.description:
Rightpoint, a Genpact company (NYSE: G) is a global experience leader. Over 700 employees across 12 offices work with clients end-to-end, from defining and enabling vision, to ensuring ongoing market relevance. Our diverse teams lead with empathy, data and creativity—always in service of the experience. From whiteboard to roll-out, we help our clients embed experience across their operations from front to back office to accelerate digital transformation through a human-centric lens. Rightpoint has been recognized among the top customer experience consultancies in The Forrester Wave™: Customer Experience Strategy Consulting Practices, Q4 2020.

Are you someone who wants to inspire change in the way business is done? Do you want to work with encouraged and like-minded intrapreneurs? Us too! We take our work very seriously, but we have fun doing it. And we’re searching for passionate, talented people to join the Rightpoint team.

Our Commitment to You

No matter who you are, where you come from, who you love, what you believe, or what you get excited about, we bring people together to make phenomenal work. That's what makes us Rightpoint!

 

What You’ll Be Doing and the Impact You’ll Make

  • Work with integrated teams including designers, developers, researchers, strategists, project managers and strategic account managers to improve experiences across industries including technology, healthcare, finance, automotive, CPG, and commerce (to name a few) 
  • Be a trusted advisor to our clients, understanding their challenges and providing insights in a way that aligns to their needs and drives data adoption in their organizations 
  • Transform data into rich, meaningful, relevant insights capable of unraveling complexity and gaining client comprehension 
  • Define and execute against analytics workstreams including measurement strategies, optimization analytics, strategic consulting, and data education 

 

What We’d Love To See:

  • Ability to generate hypotheses, run exploratory analysis, and identify trends to build relevant, story-driven insights 
  • Experience leading analytics workstreams within projects and identify cross-functional opportunities for analysts to partner 
  • Excitement and curiosity to think beyond the data to interpret business recommendations and impact 
  • Use of digital analytics platforms and subsequent data tagging structures including Google Analytics 4 and Adobe Analytics 
  • Phenomenal data visualization and analysis skills with expertise in Tableau, Power BI, Qlik, etc. 
  • Ability to understand large data sets and use appropriate technologies and methodology to manipulate data (e.g. SQL, R, Python) 
  • Experience in statistical methods and analysis such as regression, clustering, and time series analysis 
  • 5 to 10+ years of experience required. (consultancy/digital agency experience is a benefit but not a requirement). 
  • People management experience a plus 

    •   

      Key Performance Indicators 

    • Exhibit confidence and not be afraid to ask questions to bring clarity, share ideas and challenge the norm (think outside the box). 
    • Exhibit exemplary client service skills, to all people, regardless of level inside or outside of the company. 
    • Written and verbal communication skills should be professional, concise and effective. 
    • “Own” your work – take initiative, be proactive, anticipate and complete projects in a comprehensive manner. 
    • Don’t just be the student, be the teacher. Exhibit a willingness to learn, willingness to problem solve and willingness to step in to help others. 
    • Creativity, capacity and a conviction to innovate and deliver best-in-class solutions. 
    • The energy and passion to promote our capabilities internally and externally. 

     

    Why Rightpoint?

    • Flexible PTO – If you need a day off or an extended vacation, take the time!
    • Hybrid work environment: Casual and open office or Remote…You choose!
    • Great insurance coverage (Multiple Options) and flexible spending accounts
    • 401K with Company Matching
    • Regular Cultural & Social Events including: Community Volunteer Opportunities, Happy Hours, Team Outings, Intramural Sports, and more
    • Monthly WFH/cell phone stipend
    • Continuous Training, Certifications, and Learning Opportunities
    • Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion: We care about making Rightpoint a more diverse, equitable, and inclusive organization to bring about meaningful and measurable changes to representation, team member experience, and client engagement. Here's how:
      • Employee Resource Groups (ERG): Our ERGs are created and run by team members who share a common community, identity, or allyship. Right now, our ERGs include Parents, Pride, POC, and Womxn. These groups play a vital role in contributing to Rightpoint’s inclusive environment where all are valued and empowered to succeed.
      • Partnerships: Out-in-Tech, POINT Foundation, WomenHack, Girls Inc., and more!
      • Mentorship Program

     

    EEO Statement

    Rightpoint, a Genpact Company, is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, age, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, military/veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, physical or mental disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. We are committed to creating a dynamic work environment that values diversity and inclusion, respect and integrity, customer focus, and innovation.

job.title: Analytics and Insights - Lead Analyst (Contract)
job.description:
Rightpoint, a Genpact company (NYSE: G) is a global experience leader. Over 700 employees across 12 offices work with clients end-to-end, from defining and enabling vision, to ensuring ongoing market relevance. Our diverse teams lead with empathy, data and creativity—always in service of the experience. From whiteboard to roll-out, we help our clients embed experience across their operations from front to back office to accelerate digital transformation through a human-centric lens. Rightpoint has been recognized among the top customer experience consultancies in The Forrester Wave™: Customer Experience Strategy Consulting Practices, Q4 2020.

Are you someone who wants to inspire change in the way business is done? Do you want to work with encouraged and like-minded intrapreneurs? Us too! We take our work very seriously, but we have fun doing it. And we’re searching for passionate, talented people to join the Rightpoint team.

Our Commitment to You

No matter who you are, where you come from, who you love, what you believe, or what you get excited about, we bring people together to make phenomenal work. That's what makes us Rightpoint!

 

What You’ll Be Doing and the Impact You’ll Make

  • Work with integrated teams including designers, developers, researchers, strategists, project managers and strategic account managers to improve experiences across industries including technology, healthcare, finance, automotive, CPG, and commerce (to name a few) 
  • Be a trusted advisor to our clients, understanding their challenges and providing insights in a way that aligns to their needs and drives data adoption in their organizations 
  • Transform data into rich, meaningful, relevant insights capable of unraveling complexity and gaining client comprehension 
  • Define and execute against analytics workstreams including measurement strategies, optimization analytics, strategic consulting, and data education 

 

What We’d Love To See:

  • Ability to generate hypotheses, run exploratory analysis, and identify trends to build relevant, story-driven insights 
  • Experience leading analytics workstreams within projects and identify cross-functional opportunities for analysts to partner 
  • Excitement and curiosity to think beyond the data to interpret business recommendations and impact 
  • Use of digital analytics platforms and subsequent data tagging structures including Google Analytics 4 and Adobe Analytics 
  • Phenomenal data visualization and analysis skills with expertise in Tableau, Power BI, Qlik, etc. 
  • Ability to understand large data sets and use appropriate technologies and methodology to manipulate data (e.g. SQL, R, Python) 
  • Experience in statistical methods and analysis such as regression, clustering, and time series analysis 
  • 5 to 10+ years of experience required. (consultancy/digital agency experience is a benefit but not a requirement). 
  • People management experience a plus 

    •   

      Key Performance Indicators 

    • Exhibit confidence and not be afraid to ask questions to bring clarity, share ideas and challenge the norm (think outside the box). 
    • Exhibit exemplary client service skills, to all people, regardless of level inside or outside of the company. 
    • Written and verbal communication skills should be professional, concise and effective. 
    • “Own” your work – take initiative, be proactive, anticipate and complete projects in a comprehensive manner. 
    • Don’t just be the student, be the teacher. Exhibit a willingness to learn, willingness to problem solve and willingness to step in to help others. 
    • Creativity, capacity and a conviction to innovate and deliver best-in-class solutions. 
    • The energy and passion to promote our capabilities internally and externally. 

     

    Why Rightpoint?

    • Flexible PTO – If you need a day off or an extended vacation, take the time!
    • Hybrid work environment: Casual and open office or Remote…You choose!
    • Great insurance coverage (Multiple Options) and flexible spending accounts
    • 401K with Company Matching
    • Regular Cultural & Social Events including: Community Volunteer Opportunities, Happy Hours, Team Outings, Intramural Sports, and more
    • Monthly WFH/cell phone stipend
    • Continuous Training, Certifications, and Learning Opportunities
    • Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion: We care about making Rightpoint a more diverse, equitable, and inclusive organization to bring about meaningful and measurable changes to representation, team member experience, and client engagement. Here's how:
      • Employee Resource Groups (ERG): Our ERGs are created and run by team members who share a common community, identity, or allyship. Right now, our ERGs include Parents, Pride, POC, and Womxn. These groups play a vital role in contributing to Rightpoint’s inclusive environment where all are valued and empowered to succeed.
      • Partnerships: Out-in-Tech, POINT Foundation, WomenHack, Girls Inc., and more!
      • Mentorship Program

     

    EEO Statement

    Rightpoint, a Genpact Company, is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, age, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, military/veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, physical or mental disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. We are committed to creating a dynamic work environment that values diversity and inclusion, respect and integrity, customer focus, and innovation.
